title: SpaceX a bastion of independent US, European spaceflight amid Russian threats
summary: Russia has invaded Ukraine without provocation, triggering a series of diplomatic responses – sanctions in particular – that recently culminated in the...

title: GOES-T nears launch as NASA plans studies of next-generation weather satellite
summary: The latest in a series of geostationary weather satellites is ready for launch as NASA takes the next step in plans for a next generation of such spacecraft.

title: China launches national record 22 satellites on Long March 8 commercial rideshare
summary: China’s second Long March 8 rocket launched late Saturday carrying a domestic record 22 satellites for a range of commercial Chinese space companies.

title: Satellite imaging companies increase profile as they track Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
summary: The conflict in Ukraine has showcased the capabilities of commercial geospatial companies whose high-resolution satellite images have been ubiquitous for the past several weeks.

title: Russia suspends Soyuz launch operations in French Guiana
summary: Blaming European sanctions enacted after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the Russian space agency said Saturday it is recalling dozens of engineers and technicians from French Guiana and suspending Soyuz rocket operations there, grounding a pair of European navigation satellites previously set for launch in early April.
